content:
TITLE: Starting Open Canvas Development Server
DESCRIPTION: This command starts the development server for Open Canvas, allowing you to run the application locally.
SOURCE: https://github.com/langchain-ai/open-canvas/blob/main/apps/web/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
yarn dev
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running the LangGraph Server
DESCRIPTION: Command to start the LangGraph server on port 54367. This runs the agent backend that powers Open Canvas interactions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/langchain-ai/open-canvas/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
yarn dev
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running LangGraph Server for Open Canvas
DESCRIPTION: This command starts the LangGraph server for Open Canvas, which is required for the application to function.
SOURCE: https://github.com/langchain-ai/open-canvas/blob/main/apps/web/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
yarn dev:server
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Building the Open Canvas Application
DESCRIPTION: Command to build the entire Open Canvas application. This is necessary in a monorepo setup to ensure workspace dependencies are properly built for other packages to access.
SOURCE: https://github.com/langchain-ai/open-canvas/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
yarn build
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Dependencies with Yarn
DESCRIPTION: Command to install all required project dependencies using Yarn package manager. This must be run in the project root directory.
SOURCE: https://github.com/langchain-ai/open-canvas/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
yarn install
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Cloning and Accessing Open Canvas Repository
DESCRIPTION: Commands to clone the Open Canvas GitHub repository and navigate to the project directory. This is the first step in setting up Open Canvas locally.
SOURCE: https://github.com/langchain-ai/open-canvas/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git clone https://github.com/langchain-ai/open-canvas.git
cd open-canvas
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Cloning and Installing Open Canvas Repository
DESCRIPTION: These commands clone the Open Canvas repository from GitHub and install its dependencies using Yarn.
SOURCE: https://github.com/langchain-ai/open-canvas/blob/main/apps/web/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git clone https://github.com/langchain-ai/open-canvas.git
cd open-canvas
yarn install
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating Root Environment Configuration File
DESCRIPTION: Command to copy the example environment file to create the main .env file for the LangGraph server configuration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/langchain-ai/open-canvas/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
# The root `.env` file will be read by the LangGraph server for the agents.
cp .env.example .env
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating Frontend Environment Configuration File
DESCRIPTION: Commands to navigate to the web application directory and copy the example environment file for frontend configuration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/langchain-ai/open-canvas/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
# The `apps/web/.env` file will be read by the frontend.
cd apps/web/
cp .env.example .env
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Copying Environment Configuration File
DESCRIPTION: This command copies the example environment file to create a new .env file for configuration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/langchain-ai/open-canvas/blob/main/apps/web/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
cp .env.example .env
```
